commits.message: content(Hydra): Poussière de la course d'Or

pull_request.title: chore: Remove Algolia Answers capabilities
pull_request.body:
Hi there! As we are sunsetting Algolia Answers on November 1st, this PR removes the integration of the Answers API in the Discourse plugin.

I didn't dare changing the translations beyond the english one and removing the `algolia_answers_enabled` key. It is worth going through existing translations to review `site_settings.algolia_search_api_key` accordingly.

repo.name: discourse-algolia
repo.description: A plugin for indexing and searching your Discourse with Algolia

repo.description: A plugin for indexing and searching your Discourse with Algolia

payload.description: A plugin for indexing and searching your Discourse with Algolia

issue.title: Inserting an InsightsMiddleware before widgets results in urlSynced-state being cleared on reload
issue.body:
## 🐛 Bug description

When we `createInsightsMiddleware` and insert that component before other widgets in an `<InstantSearch>` page, any state that is in urlSync gets erased on page load (such as pressing Enter or navigating from another page).
CC @Haroenv with whom I discovered the root cause of the UI issue.

## 🔍 Bug reproduction



1. Create an insights middleware that sets some stuff
2. Insert it in your `<InstantSearch routing={true}>` page _before other widgets_ (such as `<RefinementList>`)
3. Click a filter to set some `urlSync`-ed parameters in the URL
4. Click on your URL and press enter
5. See the page reloading: the url is first kept, then erased during a second painting of the page

## :curly_loop: Workaround

We realized that changing the position of the middleware in the DOM, from:
```jsx
<InstantSearch>
  <InsightsMiddleware />
  <RefinementList />
  <Hits />
</InstantSearch>
```
to
```jsx
<InstantSearch>
  <RefinementList />
  <Hits />
  <InsightsMiddleware />
</InstantSearch>
```
is enough to workaround the race condition between the middleware and the other widgets. :thinking: 

**Live reproduction:**

https://codesandbox.io/s/nameless-forest-chr25g?file=/App.tsx

## 💭 Expected behavior

I'd expect the middleware to not clear the other widgets' state, _regardless of where it is inserted_.

issue.title: Could not create input device: No such device
issue.body:
I'm trying to use a Logitech MX Vertical mouse. After setting up my cfg file following the best example I could find (from #320), I see the following error when running `logid -v`:
```
[ERROR] Could not create input device: No such device
```
The mouse is paired/connected/trusted via bluetooth:
```
~ bluetoothctl info EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB

Device EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB (random)
	Name: MX Vertical
	Alias: MX Vertical
	Appearance: 0x03c2
	Icon: input-mouse
	Paired: yes
	Bonded: yes
	Trusted: yes
	Blocked: no
	Connected: yes
	LegacyPairing: no
	UUID: Generic Access Profile    (00001800-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Generic Attribute Profile (00001801-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Device Information        (0000180a-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Battery Service           (0000180f-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Human Interface Device    (00001812-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Vendor specific           (00010000-0000-1000-8000-011f2000046d)
	Modalias: usb:v046DpB020d0009
	Battery Percentage: 0x64 (100)
```

However nothing happens when I move it or click.

Any idea how to troubleshoot this situation?

commits.message: content(Hydra): Poussière de la course d'Or

pull_request.title: chore: Remove Algolia Answers capabilities
pull_request.body:
Hi there! As we are sunsetting Algolia Answers on November 1st, this PR removes the integration of the Answers API in the Discourse plugin.

I didn't dare changing the translations beyond the english one and removing the `algolia_answers_enabled` key. It is worth going through existing translations to review `site_settings.algolia_search_api_key` accordingly.

issue.title: Could not create input device: No such device
issue.body:
I'm trying to use a Logitech MX Vertical mouse. After setting up my cfg file following the best example I could find (from #320), I see the following error when running `logid -v`:
```
[ERROR] Could not create input device: No such device
```
The mouse is paired/connected/trusted via bluetooth:
```
~ bluetoothctl info EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB

Device EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB (random)
	Name: MX Vertical
	Alias: MX Vertical
	Appearance: 0x03c2
	Icon: input-mouse
	Paired: yes
	Bonded: yes
	Trusted: yes
	Blocked: no
	Connected: yes
	LegacyPairing: no
	UUID: Generic Access Profile    (00001800-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Generic Attribute Profile (00001801-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Device Information        (0000180a-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Battery Service           (0000180f-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Human Interface Device    (00001812-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Vendor specific           (00010000-0000-1000-8000-011f2000046d)
	Modalias: usb:v046DpB020d0009
	Battery Percentage: 0x64 (100)
```

However nothing happens when I move it or click.

Any idea how to troubleshoot this situation?

issue.title: Could not create input device: No such device
issue.body:
I'm trying to use a Logitech MX Vertical mouse. After setting up my cfg file following the best example I could find (from #320), I see the following error when running `logid -v`:
```
[ERROR] Could not create input device: No such device
```
The mouse is paired/connected/trusted via bluetooth:
```
~ bluetoothctl info EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB

Device EA:CC:B3:B9:23:FB (random)
	Name: MX Vertical
	Alias: MX Vertical
	Appearance: 0x03c2
	Icon: input-mouse
	Paired: yes
	Bonded: yes
	Trusted: yes
	Blocked: no
	Connected: yes
	LegacyPairing: no
	UUID: Generic Access Profile    (00001800-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Generic Attribute Profile (00001801-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Device Information        (0000180a-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Battery Service           (0000180f-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Human Interface Device    (00001812-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Vendor specific           (00010000-0000-1000-8000-011f2000046d)
	Modalias: usb:v046DpB020d0009
	Battery Percentage: 0x64 (100)
```

However nothing happens when I move it or click.

Any idea how to troubleshoot this situation?
